alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 4:42PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Marion County through 530 PM EDT... At 442 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Weir, or 9 miles northwest of The Villages, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph, pea size hail, and excessive cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Ocala, Fort McCoy, Lynne, Santos, Anthony, Ocklawaha, Moss Bluff, Silver Springs Shores, Lake Weir and Belleview. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Western Marion
